page.title: 06Population, Faceby
page.content: {The population}of Faceby, the only village wholly in the block, is 244, of whom 66 are{children of school age} or under, and 24 are{senior citizens.} The oldest resident celebrated her 100th birthday in March. In 1984 there were only 2 marriages and 1 death. {Professional people}are the largest social group. Most{householders}are owner-occupiers. The landlord of the public house, the Sutton Arms, is a local farmer's son. The only shop closed in 1974 because of the owner's ill health, and people do most of their shopping in Stokesley, 4 miles away. Among the{travelling tradesmen} or services are butchers, a fish man, greengrocer, milkman, coal merchant, hairdresser, soft drinks and laundry. There is no school;{children}attend the primary school at Carlton and the comprehensive school at Stokesley.
